title: Royal Shrovetide Football Challenge Walking Route

images.title: Victoria Square in Ashbourne by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Victoria Square in Ashbourne

images.caption: Red Lion, Kniveton

images.caption: Tissington Hall

images.title: Footpath towards Snelston by River Dove by Chris Wimbush, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath towards Snelston by River Dove

description: This walk celebrates the Royal Shrovetide Football Match which occurs annually on Shrove Tuesday in the town of Ashbourne. The game is played on a 3 mile long pitch and takes place over two days. The walk starts and ends in Ashbourne and follows waymarked tracks and country lanes through Kniveton, Tissington, Fenny Bentley, Thorpe and Mapleton. The route includes a delightful waterside section along the River Dove from Thorpe to Church Mayfield. Attractions on the route include the beautiful Jacobean Mansion at Tissington Hall. The mansion is set in lovely grounds and offers fabulous views of the Peak District. You'll also link up with the popular Tissington Trail, a shared cycling and walking trail running through the area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Derbyshire Walks and the Staffordshire Walks pages.
